basics.name: Bardia Ardakanian
basics.label: Machine Learning Engineer
basics.summary: I am a Computer Engineering graduate from Amirkabir University of Technology, specializing in robotics and computer vision. As a research assistant, I have conducted significant work in computer vision, deep learning, and reinforcement learning. In the industry, I have led projects in robotics and machine learning, as well as performed business data analysis and machine learning engineering. Adept with a wide range of data science tools and technologies, I am passionate about robotics, deep learning, and computer vision, dedicated to developing innovative solutions in these fields.

work.name: Sepid Daneh Zarvan Toos Co.
work.summary: I develop robotic control systems and lead projects in robotics, machine learning, and data analytics to enhance operational efficiency and reduce costs.
highlights: Developed robot control systems for sorting and packaging robotic arms, resulting in a 10% reduction in operational costs.
Conducted comprehensive business data analysis and implemented new business strategies, achieving a 17% cost reduction.
Optimized delivery service routing and distribution logistics, leading to a 28% decrease in operational expenses.
Engineered and programmed complex systems including conveyor belts, robotic arms, and sorting sections to streamline the packaging line.
Coordinated the synchronization of multiple automated systems, ensuring seamless and efficient performance across the production process.

work.name: System Group Co.
work.summary: Software Developer involved in the Rahkaran ERP solution as a member of the compensation module team, enhancing system performance and user interface.
highlights: Developed a new service compensation module for Rahkaran ERP, improving processing speed.
Redesigned the user interface using Angular, JavaScript, and HTML/CSS, enhancing user experience and system usability.
Actively participated in the debugging team, resolving zero-day bugs that impacted core ERP features, ensuring system stability and reliability.

work.name: Fanap Soft Co.
work.summary: Backend Developer leading the transformation of WePod's infrastructure to microservices and developing critical financial transaction modules.
highlights: Led the transformation of WePod infrastructure from monolithic to microservice architecture, increasing system speed by 240% and enhancing overall performance.
Converted key money transfer services (Paya, Satna, and Debit) into microservices, improving scalability and reliability of financial transactions.
Developed essential modules, including online card password changes and eligibility filters for money transfer requests, enhancing service offerings.
Served as Scrum Master, fostering Agile methodologies to improve team collaboration, streamline development processes, and support iterative project delivery.
Implemented a comprehensive system recovery solution for server infrastructure, ensuring high availability and operational resilience.

The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.
